Context:
George Brown College is an institution governed by the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA). The college collects and maintains personal information about all students and employees. Individuals have a right to access their personal information held by the college, as well as the right to protect their privacy.

Access requests for information or records should be made in writing to the Freedom of Information & Privacy Coordinator, who can be contacted at ext. 4646, 416-415-2000, or ask.george@georgebrown.ca. A completed form and a $5 application fee are required for access requests. The college's policies and frequently used documents related to FIPPA compliance can be found on their website.

Additionally, the college has a land acknowledgment and offers various ways to stay informed about application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, and tours by signing up on their website or social media hub. The contact details for the college are 416-415-2000 (voice) and 1-877-515-5559 (TTY).

George Brown College's policies and operations are subject to change without notice, and it is the responsibility of students to verify college fee requirements.
